model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Did you look for tickets to visit me?
I have been watching the airfare. I'm waiting for the prices to go down a little. How's the weather there this week?
It's lovely this week! Clear skies and sunshine every single day
That sounds nice. It's been rainy here. Are there any good concerts coming up that you plan to see? Maybe I can plan my visit around that if the flights come through
Actually, yes! There are a few local artists performing in about 4 weeks, they'll be performing folk music. I'd love to take you out on the town and then enjoy that concert later in the evening if you're interested.
That sounds good. I'm looking forward to it. Do you think I will need to rent a car when I'm there, or is it possible to walk and bike in the summer? I always picture huge amounts of snow but I'm not sure if it's like that all year round.
I would definitely recommend looking for a rental car to have on hand. There is a town within walking distance from me, but it can be dangerous to walk with the wolves and elk around, especially at night.
I imagine so!!! I wouldn't want to run into a wolf! Ok. I will add car rental to my plans. Do you get scared with your dogs, that you will run into wildilfe like that?

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Visiting Alaska', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker B confirms finding suitable flights to visit Alaska and plans to attend a concert while there.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: Wow, sign me up! Actually I think I found some flights that work for my schedule and price. Thanks so much for the heads up - looks like I'll be seeing you in a couple weeks. ### Speaker A: I just told everyone you're coming, they're so excited! ### Speaker B: Well I guess the decision is made. I better get a ticket. Lets go to a concert while I'm there.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Activities in Alaska', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and B discuss plans for the visit including concerts, outdoor activities, and wildlife experiences.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: Sure thing! We can cram into my smart cart and I will make you poached eggs every morning for breakfast. We will have a balst! ### Speaker B: That sounds as fun as it will be to finally get to pet a wolf. Maybe we could do eggs just one day? ### Speaker A: Haha. Eggs only day is fine! I will take you on a tour and we can take sleds pulled by our dogs. ### Speaker B: That sounds amazing. i'll check priceline tonight.  ### Speaker A: Do you want to go to folk or indie concert or both? I will get our tickets ready. ### Speaker B: I think a folk concert. I'm more excited about seeing the outdoors. I definitely want to go on a glacier tour ### Speaker A: We will do all the guided tours in the daytime and folk concerts at night. I am going to make sure you have a great time.' }
```
